oai_dc:dc.dc:title: New models for school meals. School food provision systems in Germany
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Strassner, Carola
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Several European countries have public goals for increased organic production and consumption. The CORE-organic project iPOPY combines studies of drivers and constraints for public organic food procurement with studies of best practice cases. Four work packages study policies for increased organic consumption, supply chain management and certification issues, consumersâ€™ preferences, and actual health-related eating habits. This presentation covers School Food Provision Systems in Germany.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Strassner, Carola (2008) New models for school meals. School food provision systems in Germany. Paper at: BioFach Congress: School Food Provision Systems in DK, NO, FI, IT, DE and Case Studies, Nuremberg, Germany, 23.02.2008. [Completed]
